column4: Hello everyone, I have a small problem setting up the connection via wifi between my two computers. Let's call them "Mac" and "PC". Mac runs OSX and WinXP. PC runs Ubuntu Gutsy. Mac connects directly to the internet, via ethernet/pppoe, and should serve the connection to the PC via wifi. When Mac runs OSX, all is well, the PC with Ubuntu can see the connection and connect (though only if I set Ubuntu wireless interface to "managed" mode a

nd use "restricted" key). When Mac is running WinXP, I can't connect. I use the same essid and password when Mac is on WinXP, but XP "automatically" sets the auth mode to open. I tried changing the mode to ad-hoc and the key to open on Ubunut (via iwconfig), to no avail.
